block.p: It had the makings of a perfect stunt: moral purpose, high drama, a 1.2-mile drift net. But when Greenpeace strung a net last month across the Seine in Paris to dramatize dangers to coastal fisheries, the event fell oddly flat. It had none of the panache of AIDS activists slipping a giant pink condom over the obelisk in the Place de la Concorde a few weeks earlier, or of the artist Christo's wrapping of the Pont Neuf in 1985. Greenpeace needs more art in its politics. Christo needs more daring (lack of permission would never stop Greenpeace from wrapping the Reichstag). Maybe they should team up on the whale issue and wrap Norway.
